body.p: 1. Bela’s son from Benjamin’s tribe (1 Chr 8:5); perhaps the same person as Hupham (Nm 26:39).

2. Alternate spelling of Hiram, the Phoenician king of Tyre who was an ally of David and Solomon and who supplied materials for the building of the temple (2 Chr 2:3, 11-12; 8:2, 18; 9:10, 21). See Hiram #1.
3. Alternate spelling of Hiram, a craftsman from Tyre who worked on Solomon’s temple (2 Chr 4:11, nlt “Huram-abi”). See Hiram #2.
